info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued December 24 at 6:43AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: THE FOLLOWING MESSAGE IS TRANSMITTED AT THE REQUEST OF THE FOREST SERVICE UTAH AVALANCHE CENTER. * WHAT...THE AVALANCHE DANGER IS HIGH WITH DANGEROUS AVALANCHE CONDITIONS. * WHERE...NORTHERN WASATCH MOUNTAINS IN FRANKLIN AND BEAR LAKE COUNTIES. * WHEN...IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM MST THIS MORNING TO 6 AM MST SATURDAY.. * IMPACTS...RECENT HEAVY SNOW COMBINED WITH WIND WILL LIKELY CREATE WIDESPREAD AREAS OF UNSTABLE SNOW. BOTH HUMAN TRIGGERED AND NATURAL AVALANCHES ARE LIKELY. STAY OFF OF AND OUT FROM UNDER SLOPES STEEPER THAN 30 DEGREES. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... BACKCOUNTRY TRAVELERS SHOULD STAY OFF OF, AND OUT FROM UNDERNEATH, SLOPES STEEPER THAN 30 DEGREES. AVALANCHES MAY RUN LONG DISTANCES AND CAN RUN INTO MATURE FORESTS. CHOOSE CONSERVATIVE TERRAIN. CONSULT WWW.UTAHAVALANCHECENTER.ORG OR CALL 1-888-999-4019 FOR MORE DETAILED INFORMATION. SIMILAR AVALANCHE DANGER MAY EXIST AT LOCATIONS OUTSIDE THE COVERAGE AREA OF THIS OR ANY AVALANCHE CENTER.
